items.title: Why bad sleep doesn't always lead to depression
items.summary: Poor sleep is both a risk factor, and a common symptom, of depression. But not everyone who tosses and turns at night becomes depressed. Individuals whose brains are more attuned to rewards may be protected from the negative mental health effects of poor sleep, says a new study.

alternate.title: Why bad sleep doesn't always lead to depression

thumbnail.title: Why bad sleep doesn't always lead to depression

items.title: People's love of the seas could be the key for plastic pollution solution
items.summary: Tapping into the public's passion for the ocean could be the key to reducing the threats to it posed by plastic pollution.

alternate.title: People's love of the seas could be the key for plastic pollution solution

thumbnail.title: People's love of the seas could be the key for plastic pollution solution

items.title: A new approach to ultrafast light pulses
items.summary: A team of researchers has found a new way of producing high-speed pulses of light using two-dimensional molecular aggregates, which could enable new photonic devices such as optically based microchips.

alternate.title: A new approach to ultrafast light pulses

thumbnail.title: A new approach to ultrafast light pulses

items.title: More evidence of water on Mars
items.summary: River deposits exist across the surface of Mars and record a surface environment from over 3.5 billion years ago that was able to support liquid water at the surface. A region of Mars named Aeolis Dorsa contains some of the most spectacular and densely packed river deposits seen on Mars.

alternate.title: More evidence of water on Mars

thumbnail.title: More evidence of water on Mars

items.title: New assay leads to step toward gene therapy for deaf patients
items.summary: Scientists at have taken an important step toward gene therapy for deaf patients by developing a way to better study a large protein essential for hearing and finding a truncated version of it.

alternate.title: New assay leads to step toward gene therapy for deaf patients

thumbnail.title: New assay leads to step toward gene therapy for deaf patients

items.title: Biologists identify gene involved in kidney-related birth defects
items.summary: Researchers have identified a gene linked to rare kidney-related birth defects. When working properly, a gene called GREB1L activates a cascade of signals that ultimately tells other genes what they need to do to create a kidney.

alternate.title: Biologists identify gene involved in kidney-related birth defects

items.title: Urgent emission reductions needed to achieve 1.5째C warming limit
items.summary: Significant emission reductions are required if we are to achieve one of the key goals of the Paris Agreement, and limit the increase in global average temperatures to 1.5째C; a new partnership warns.
